name: @sapphire/discord-utilities
readme:
![Sapphire Logo](https://cdn.skyra.pw/gh-assets/sapphire-banner.png) # @sapphire/discord-utilities **Discord specific utilities for your JavaScript/TypeScript bots.** [![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/sapphiredev/utilities)](https://github.com/sapphiredev/utilities/blob/main/LICENSE.md) [![codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/sapphiredev/utilities/branch/main/graph/badge.svg?token=OEGIV6RFDO)](https://codecov.io/gh/sapphiredev/utilities) [![npm bundle size](https://img.shields.io/bundlephobia/min/@sapphire/discord-utilities?logo=webpack&style=flat-square)](https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=@sapphire/discord-utilities) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@sapphire/discord-utilities?color=crimson&logo=npm&style=flat-square)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sapphire/discord-utilities)
## Description When developing Discord bots or frameworks for Discord bots we often run into certain constants such as regex's, channel type resolutions and other common functions that would be really nice to get from 1 centralized place. That's where @sapphire/discord-utilities come in. This package provides common Discord specific utilities for your Discord bots. **Important**: If you're looking for [Discord.js] specific utilities then install [@sapphire/discord.js-utilities] instead. [@sapphire/discord.js-utilities] re-exports this package at the root level and peer-depends on this package. ## Features - Written in TypeScript - Bundled with esbuild so it can be used in NodeJS and browsers - Offers CommonJS, ESM and UMD bundles - Fully tested - Discord library agnostic ## Installation You can use the following command to install this package, or replace `npm install` with your package manager of choice. ```sh npm install @sapphire/discord-utilities ``` --- ## Buy us some doughnuts Sapphire Community is and always will be open source, even if we don't get donations. That being said, we know there are amazing people who may still want to donate just to show their appreciation. Thank you very much in advance! We accept donations through Open Collective, Ko-fi, Paypal, Patreon and GitHub Sponsorships. You can use the buttons below to donate through your method of choice. | Donate With | Address | | :-------------: | :-------------------------------------------------: | | Open Collective | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/opencollective) | | Ko-fi | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/kofi) | | Patreon | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/patreon) | | PayPal | [Click Here](https://sapphirejs.dev/paypal) | ## Contributors ✨ Thanks goes to these wonderful people ([emoji key](https://allcontributors.org/docs/en/emoji-key)):

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord application commands (slash commands).

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in an application command description.
Maximum characters allowed in an application command name.
Maximum options allowed in an application command.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Choices of Discord Application Commands.

summary.text: Maximum length of choices allowed in the option of an application command.
Maximum characters allowed in the description of an option of an application command.
Maximum characters allowed in the name of an option of an application command.

comment.description: Namespace container limits related to Discord autocomplete interactions.

summary.text: Maximum options allowed in a single autocomplete response.
Maximum characters allowed in a select menu option's name.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Message Buttons.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in a button custom ID.
Maximum characters allowed in a button label.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord channels.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in a channel description.
Maximum characters allowed in a channel name.
Maximum viewers allowed per screen share.

comment.description: Regex that can capture the ID in Discord Channel mentions

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the ID of the channel. It is named `id`.

comment.description:
Regex that can capture the channel and message IDs in a channelId-messageId pattern
This pattern can be found when you hold Shift and hover over a message, and click the "ID" button

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the ID of the channel, named `channelId`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 is the ID of the message, named `messageId`.

comment.description: Regex that matches links on the known Discord host names

blockTags.name: raw
blockTags.text: `/(?<subdomain>\w+)\.?(?<hostname>dis(?:cord)?(?:app|merch|status)?)\.(?<tld>com|g(?:d|g|ift)|(?:de(?:sign|v))|media|new|store|net)/i`

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: The regex is case insensitive

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the subdomain for this URL. It is named `subdomain`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 is the hostname for this URL, primarily `discord` but can also be `discordmerch`, `discordstatus`, `dis`, and `discordapp`. It is named `hostname`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 3 is the Top-Level Domain *without* `.`. It is named `tld`.

comment.description: Regex that can can capture the code of Discord invite links

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the invite URL's unique code. It is named `code`.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord embeds.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in the author field of an embed.
Maximum characters allowed in an embed description.
Maximum characters allowed in the name of a field in an embed.
Maximum characters allowed in the value of a field in an embed.
Maximum fields allowed in an embed.
Maximum characters allowed in a footer of an embed.
Maximum characters allowed in the title of an embed.
Maximum characters allowed in an embed, in total.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord emojis.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in a custom guild emoji.

comment.description: Regex that can capture the ID of any animated or non-animated custom Discord emoji

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 can be used to determine whether the emoji is animated or not. It is named `animated`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 is the name of the emoji as it is typed in a message. It is named `name`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 3 is the ID of the emoji. It is named `id`.

comment.description:
Regex that matches any animated or non-animated custom Discord emoji.
Unlike {@link EmojiRegex} It can be a substring of a larger string.

Regex that can capture any animated or non-animated custom Discord emoji.
Similar to {@link FormattedCustomEmoji} and unlike {@link EmojiRegex} can also be a substring of a larger string.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 can be used to determine whether the emoji is animated or not. It is named `animated`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 is the name of the emoji as it is typed in a message. It is named `name`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 3 is the ID of the emoji. It is named `id`.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord guilds.

summary.text: Maximum channels allowed per guild, including category channels.
Maximum roles allowed in a guild.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord guild members.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in the display name of a guild member.

comment.description: Regex that matches any URL starting with `http` or `https`

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: for WebSocket URLs see {@link WebsocketGenericUrlRegex}

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord interactions.

summary.text: Maximum buttons allowed in a single action row.
Maximum options allowed in a single select menu.
Maximum select menus allowed in a single action row.
Maximum text inputs allowed in a single action row.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord messages.

summary.text: Maximum action rows allowed in a single message.
Maximum embeds allowed in a single message.
Maximum characters allowed in a single message for a user.
Maximum characters allowed in a single message for a nitro user.

Maximum upload size for a nitro user, in any guild or in DMs.
Size is in bytes, and correspond to 10MB.
Maximum numbers of reactions allowed for a message.

Maximum upload size for a free user in a guild of tier 1 or below, or in DMs.
Size is in bytes, and correspond to 8MB.

Maximum upload size for a free user for all different boost levels available in a guild.
Sizes are in bytes, and correspond to 8MB, 8MB, 50MB, and 100MB.

comment.description: Regex that can capture the Guild, Channel, and Message ID based on a shareable Discord message link.

blockTags.name: raw
blockTags.text: `/^(?:https://)?(?:ptb\.|canary\.)?discord(?:app)?\.com/channels/(?<guildId>(?:\d{17,20}|@me))/(?<channelId>\d{17,20})/(?<messageId>\d{17,20})$/`

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the ID of the guild the message was sent in. It is named `guildId`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 is the ID of the channel in that guild the message was sent in. It is named `channelId`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 3 is the ID of the message itself. It is named `messageId`.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord Modals.

summary.text: Maximum components allowed in a modal.
Maximum characters allowed in a modal custom ID.
Maximum characters allowed in a modal title.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to built-in moderation features.

summary.text: Maximum duration of a guild timeout, in seconds (corresponds to 28 days).

comment.description:
Regex that matches any animated or non-animated custom Discord emoji *without the wrapping `<...>` symbols.
This means that a string that matches this regex can directly be send inside a Discord message.
Other than this difference it is similar to {@link FormattedCustomEmoji}.

Regex that matches any animated or non-animated custom Discord emoji *without the wrapping `<...>` symbols.
This means that a string that matches this regex can directly be send inside a Discord message.
Other than this difference it is similar to {@link FormattedCustomEmojiWithGroups}.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 can be used to determine whether the emoji is animated or not. It is named `animated`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 is the name of the emoji as it is typed in a message. It is named `name`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 3 is the ID of the emoji. It is named `id`.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord roles.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in a role name.

comment.description: Regex that can capture the ID in Discord Role mentions

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the ID of the role. It is named `id`.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Select Menus.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in a select menu custom ID.
Maximum characters allowed in a select menu option's name.
Maximum "maximum" values allowed in a select menu.
Maximum "minimum" values allowed in a select menu.
Maximum amount of options allowed in a select menu.
Maximum characters allowed in a select menu placeholder.

comment.description: Regex that can capture any Discord Snowflake ID

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the Snowflake. It is named `id`.

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord Modal Text Input component.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in a text input custom ID.
Maximum characters allowed in a text input label.
Maximum characters allowed in a text input placeholder.
Maximum characters allowed in a text input value.

comment.description: Regex that can capture a Discord Token

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 can be used to retrieve a token for a User that has Multi-Factor Authentication enabled. It is named `mfaToken`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 can be used to retrieve a token for a User that doesn't have Multi-Factor Authentication enabled, or a Bot application. It is named `basicToken`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text:
For a valid token, either Capture group 1 or Capture group 2 will always be undefined, whereas the other group will then be defined and
contain the matched token.
You can use the name of the capture group to determine if the validated token was configured for a user with Multi-Factor Authentication, for a user without Multi-Factor Authentication, or for a bot application.
If both capture groups are undefined, then the token is invalid.

comment.description: Regex that can capture a Twemoji (Twitter Emoji)

blockTags.name: raw
blockTags.text: {@linkplain See official source code}

comment.description: Namespace containing limits related to Discord users and Direct Messages.

summary.text: Maximum characters allowed in a user's biography (the "About Me" section).
Maximum numbers of users in a DM group.

comment.description: Regex that can capture the ID of a user in Discord user mentions

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the ID of the user. It is named `id`.

comment.description: Regex that matches any WebSocket URL starting with `ws` or `wss`

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: for regular HTTP URLs see {@link HttpUrlRegex}

comment.description: Regex that captures the Webhook ID and token from a Discord Webhook URL.

blockTags.name: raw
blockTags.text: `/(?<url>^https://(?:(?:canary|ptb).)?discord(?:app)?.com/api(?:/v\d+)?/webhooks/(?<id>\d+)/(?<token>[\w-]+)/?$)/`

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 1 is the full URL of the Discord Webhook. It is named `url`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 2 is the ID of the Discord Webhook. It is named `id`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: Capture group 3 is the token of the Discord Webhook. It is named `token`.

blockTags.name: remark
blockTags.text: for regular HTTP URLs see {@link HttpUrlRegex}
